TopicTitle: looking for modded mk1 lander can that references the z-axis instead of y-axis

Articles.Content:
this what you have when you are controlling from the lander can. note the nav ball, its referencing the y-axis. good for conventional landers, no good for spaceplanes.

look at the navball in this picture, its referencing the positive z-axis of the can. I achieved this by controlling from the little probe core thingy on the front. Its a decent work-around, but I cant fly from the cockpit because it automatically goes back to referencing the y-axis of the lander can.

I could have sworn that I saw a modded lander can floating around somewhere that does exactly this, but now I cant find it... any ideas?
